net.novazero.lib.ikbus.io

Class TimeRestrictedInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.novazero.lib.ikbus.io.TimeRestrictedInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class TimeRestrictedInputStream
extends Object
implements Closeable
    An input stream wrapper class used for creating an input stream whose read calls can timeout. Note that you always close your streams after use to prevent resource leaks. This is especially true for the TimeRestrictedInputStream since it starts a daemon thread to read from the underlying InputStream. Failing to close the TimeRestrictedInputStream may result in stale daemon threads.
    Author:
    Daan Scheerens

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int END_OF_STREAM
      Result returned by the read method if the end of the stream has been reached.
      static int TIMEOUT
      Result returned by the read method if a timeout occurred while reading the next byte from the input stream.

      TimeRestrictedInputStream(InputStream inputStream, long defaultTimeout)
      Creates a new TimeRestrictedInputStream instance for the given input stream and with the specified default timeout period.

      • read

        public int read()
         throws IOException
        Reads a byte from the input stream. If no byte was received within the default timeout period, then this method will quit and return the value of TIMEOUT. Otherwise of the end of stream has been reached, this method returns END_OF_STREAM.
        Returns:
        The byte that was read, END_OF_STREAM if the end of the stream has been reached or TIMEOUT if no byte was received within the specified amount of time.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O occurs while reading from the stream.

      • read

        public int read(long timeout)
         throws IOException
        Reads a byte from the input stream. If no byte was received within the default timeout period, then this method will quit and return the value of TIMEOUT. Otherwise of the end of stream has been reached, this method returns END_OF_STREAM. When a timeout period of 0 milliseconds is specified, then this will be interpreted as an infinite period and the read call will block indefinitely.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for a byte before timing out. If a timeout period of 0 milliseconds is specified, then this method waits indefinitely until a byte is available from the input stream.
        Returns:
        The byte that was read, END_OF_STREAM if the end of the stream has been reached or TIMEOUT if no byte was received within the specified amount of time.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O occurs while reading from the stream.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes the input stream. If the input stream was already closed, nothing will happen.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException - If there was an I/O when closing the wrapped input stream.
